channel.title: Think I should buy it?
channel.description:
This guy down the street is moving and needs to sell his 1966 chevy impala because he has no room for it
only 22,753 miles on it A 396 SS 402 Cubic Inches 375hp 8 Cylinder Engine Automatic 3 Speed rebuilt transmission new tires the body is in fair condition and needs to be repainted
he is asking for about 8,500$ for it think its worth it?
tell me what you think
[IMG]http://i499.photobucket.com/albums/rr359/xmand/myfuturecar.jpg[/img]

item.title: Think I should buy it?
item.dc:creator: @nacional nacional
item.description:
@nacional wrote:

I’d go for it, specially if you have room for it in your car.
investment prob.

Read full topic

item.title: Think I should buy it?
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

[quote=“5, post:7, topic:318874”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=415332.msg3056982#msg3056982 date=1260565968]

Not such a sexy car right now, too expensive? If you do buy it then please get a kickass paintjob and some hydraulics

Never do this ever ever ever! (hydraulics that is)

Back ontopic, get the VIN number and run it through one of those online checkers to see if it is actually an original 396SS. Also, the odometer on that car only goes up to 99,999. This means that 22k miles showing on the odometer could mean 22k, 122k, 222k, 322k etc etc. Check it out on the title.

Also, on all old cars like this, check inside the trunk (you should be able to see the inside of the quarter panels) and feel inside of all the wheel wells and such for bondo. If everything he says is true (actually 22k miles, original 396SS, perfect body with no bondo/fiberglass etc) then it is worth every penny of $8500, otherwise it might not be.

If you get really serious about it, check prices on similar cars on ebay and such to see what they are going for.

[/quote]

on the title it says the odometer reads at 22,751

I verified the Vin so it is a Real 396SS (done through http://www.decodethis.com/Home/tabid/36/Default.aspx) may try some other sites aswell

Think the D.M.V could tell me info on the car If I provide the VIN to them?[/quote]
They should be able to as long as the car has been registered in the system with the new title that he is using. They will tell you about how many previous owners it had, if they have wrecked, if it was ever used in illegal actions, also they are able to tell you if the odometer is reading right. Because every time the title is changed, the odometer number changes… Such as one of the owners could have it reading at 80k then he buys it and it reads at 22k… Which means like Moparisthebest said that he is at about 122k miles… But just make sure you take some cash to the D.M.V just incase they charge you, depending on where u live.

Read full topic

[/quote]

Never do this ever ever ever! (hydraulics that is)

Back ontopic, get the VIN number and run it through one of those online checkers to see if it is actually an original 396SS. Also, the odometer on that car only goes up to 99,999. This means that 22k miles showing on the odometer could mean 22k, 122k, 222k, 322k etc etc. Check it out on the title.

Also, on all old cars like this, check inside the trunk (you should be able to see the inside of the quarter panels) and feel inside of all the wheel wells and such for bondo. If everything he says is true (actually 22k miles, original 396SS, perfect body with no bondo/fiberglass etc) then it is worth every penny of $8500, otherwise it might not be.

If you get really serious about it, check prices on similar cars on ebay and such to see what they are going for.[/quote]

on the title it says the odometer reads at 22,751

I verified the Vin so it is a Real 396SS (done through http://www.decodethis.com/Home/tabid/36/Default.aspx) may try some other sites aswell

Think the D.M.V could tell me info on the car If I provide the VIN to them?

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Eh Pretty Easy:

Not such a sexy car right now, too expensive? If you do buy it then please get a kickass paintjob and some hydraulics

Never do this ever ever ever! (hydraulics that is)

Back ontopic, get the VIN number and run it through one of those online checkers to see if it is actually an original 396SS. Also, the odometer on that car only goes up to 99,999. This means that 22k miles showing on the odometer could mean 22k, 122k, 222k, 322k etc etc. Check it out on the title.

Also, on all old cars like this, check inside the trunk (you should be able to see the inside of the quarter panels) and feel inside of all the wheel wells and such for bondo. If everything he says is true (actually 22k miles, original 396SS, perfect body with no bondo/fiberglass etc) then it is worth every penny of $8500, otherwise it might not be.

If you get really serious about it, check prices on similar cars on ebay and such to see what they are going for.
